definition: to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
more than one can attend to (idiom)/deluged (with inquiries etc)/overwhelmed (by the beauty of the scenery)

sentences.chinese: 來訪者多得讓他應接不暇。

sentences.english: The firm has more clients than it can take care of.
sentences.chinese: 這家商行的主顧多得應接不暇。

sentences.english: Deliver checked items to departing guests in the absence of a door or bell attendant.
sentences.chinese: 在門僮或應接服務生缺席時將物品送給離店客人。

sentences.english: You do not have to take in new orders.
sentences.chinese: 新的定貨單實在使他們應接不暇了。

sentences.english: We were inundated with requests for further information.
sentences.chinese: 要求提供進一步信息的人極多，我們應接不暇。

sentences.english: Three emergency cases came into the hospital at the same time and the doctors really had their hands full.
sentences.chinese: 三個急診病人被同時送到醫院，醫生們真是應接不暇。

sentences.english: He is besieged with visitors from abroad.
sentences.chinese: 海外客人紛至遝來，弄得他應接不暇。

sentences.english: We have been deluged with applications for the job.
sentences.chinese: 申請這個工作的求職信使我們應接不暇。

sentences.english: The season swamps us under wave after wave of produce.
sentences.chinese: 這個季節一波一波的農產品讓我們應接不暇。

sentences.english: They have more business than they can do now.
sentences.chinese: 現在他們的生意是應接不暇。
